1.text: AND on the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came to the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared.

2.text: And they found the stone rolled back from the sepulchre.

3.text: And going in, they found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.text: And it came to pass, as they were astonished in their mind at this, behold, two men stood by them, in shining apparel.

5.text: And as they were afraid, and bowed down their countenance towards the ground, they said unto them: Why seek you the living with the dead?

6.text: He is not here, but is risen. Remember how he spoke unto you, when he was in Galilee,

7.text: Saying: The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

9.text: And going back from the sepulchre, they told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.

10.text: And it was Mary Magdalen, and Joanna, and Mary of James, and the other women that were with them, who told these things to the apostles.

11.text: And these words seemed to them as idle tales; and they did not believe them.

12.text: But Peter rising up, ran to the sepulchre, and stooping down, he saw the linen cloths laid by themselves; and went away wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.

13.text: And behold, two of them went, the same day, to a town which was sixty furlongs from Jerusalem, named Emmaus.

14.text: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.

15.text: And it came to pass, that while they talked and reasoned with themselves, Jesus himself also drawing near, went with them.

16.text: But their eyes were held, that they should not know him.

17.text: And he said to them: What are these discourses that you hold one with another as you walk, and are sad?

18.text: And the one of them, whose name was Cleophas, answering, said to him: Art thou only a stranger to Jerusalem, and hast not known the things that have been done there in these days?

19.text: To whom he said: What things? And they said: Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, who was a prophet, mighty in work and word before God and all the people;

20.text: And how our chief priests and princes delivered him to be condemned to death, and crucified him.

21.text: But we hoped, that it was he that should have redeemed Israel: and now besides all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.

22.text: Yea and certain women also of our company affrighted us, who before it was light, were at the sepulchre,

23.text: And not finding his body, came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, who say that he is alive.

24.text: And some of our people went to the sepulchre, and found it so as the women had said, but him they found not.

25.text: Then he said to them: O foolish, and slow of heart to believe in all things which the prophets have spoken.

26.text: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and so to enter into his glory?

27.text: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded to them in all the scriptures, the things that were concerning him.

28.text: And they drew night to the town, whither they were going: and he made as though he would go farther.

29.text: But they constrained him; saying: Stay with us, because it is towards evening, and the day is now far spent. And he went in with them.

30.text: And it came to pass, whilst he was at table with them, he took bread, and blessed, and brake, and gave to them.

31.text: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him: and he vanished out of their sight.

32.text: And they said one to the other: Was not our heart burning within us, whilst he spoke in this way, and opened to us the scriptures?

33.text: And rising up, the same hour, they went back to Jerusalem: and they found the eleven gathered together, and those that were staying with them,

34.text: Saying: The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.

35.text: And they told what things were done in the way; and how they knew him in the breaking of the bread.

36.text: Now whilst they were speaking these things, Jesus stood in the midst of them, and saith to them: Peace be to you; it is I, fear not.

37.text: But they being troubled and frightened, supposed that they saw a spirit.

38.text: And he said to them: Why are you troubled, and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?

39.text: See my hands and feet, that it is I myself; handle, and see: for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as you see me to have.

40.text: And when he had said this, he shewed them his hands and feet.

41.text: But while they yet believed not, and wondered for joy, he said: Have you any thing to eat?

42.text: And they offered him a piece of a broiled fish, and a honeycomb.

43.text: And when he had eaten before them, taking the remains, he gave to them.

44.text: And he said to them: These are the words which I spoke to you, while I was yet with you, that all things must needs be fulfilled, which are written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, concerning me.

45.text: Then he opened their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures.

46.text: And he said to them: Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise again from the dead, the third day:

47.text: And that penance and remission of sins should be preached in his name, unto all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

48.text: And you are witnesses of these things.

49.text: And I send the promise of my Father upon you: but stay you in the city till you be endued with power from on high.

50.text: And he led them out as far as Bethania: and lifting up his hands, he blessed them.

51.text: And it came to pass, whilst he blessed them, he departed from them, and was carried up to heaven.

52.text: And they adoring went back into Jerusalem with great joy.

53.text: And they were always in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
